medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Diarrhea began 6 months ago after drinking 'dirty water' while snowbound in northern New England. Three days before admission, weakness started in the right hand, followed by increasing weakness in the left hand. Over the next 2 days, weakness progressed throughout the body, limiting mobility and becoming associated with diffuse muscle pain, sporadic vomiting, and multiple episodes of diarrhea. The patient became bedridden and required assistance with daily activities.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Four years prior, the patient experienced a prolonged period of recurrent diarrhea which resolved spontaneously, and a history of fractured arm and nose from a motor vehicle accident 5 months ago.
medical_history.family_history: Several relatives had cancer; there was no family history of diarrheal illnesses.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was born in Brazil, moved to northeastern U.S. 8 years ago, lived with friends in coastal New England, and was sexually active with partners, including one who was HIV-positive. He had a history of alcohol abuse and occasional illicit drug use (cocaine and marijuana), stopping alcohol consumption 6 months prior and smoking 1.5 years before moving to the U.S. He consumed unpasteurized milk and dairy products as well as raw fish and meat about 6 months prior to presentation. No exposure to sick contacts or animals was reported.
